full_text:
Rating Maintenance Configuration

Lesson
objectives

* Configure the rating plugin to allow rate books
to be tested prior to releasing into a
production environment

¢ Describe ways to enhance rating performance

| Configure IRatingPlugin G

¢ Set the implementation class for the rating plugin (for example, PCRatingPlugin)

¢ Set the RatingLevel parameter that controls the minimum rate book status
considered during rate book selection

* Default level is Active for the production environment

* Lower level can be set for the development or test environment (for example,Stage)

ieonfiguration [i config i plugin Ei registry IRatingPiugingwp
3 eB iRatingPlugingwp *
E Name: [iRatingPiugin

Er intertace: | RatingPtugin

g\+ Gosu Class qw-pluginpolicyperiod.impl.PCRatingPlugin ~

1d.impl.PCRatingPlugin}

Environment:

$2 Struct

Server:
Co Disabtea

Parameters: Name. Yat Environment | Server | 4
fRatinglevel_ Active

| Physical tables for rate tables Gi

¢ Default physical table
* Defined in DefaultRateFactorRow.eti
« Avery large generic physical table used to store many rate tables for most lines of business
* Indexing and performance tuning of large tables takes more time
* Custom physical table
« Example: CoverageRateFactor.eti for simple coverage-based rate tables
* Create a custom table when you need a medium sized table, which must have
+ A foreign key to the RateTable entity

+ Atleast two columns, one for parameter and one for factor

| Ways to improve rate table performance

¢ Use the rate table lookup strategy in a rate book

« Use rate table normalization

| Rate table lookup strategy

Fi
« Arate table can be loaded into memory or accessed from the database

¢ By default, it is loaded into memory providing quick access

« Loading a large rate table may slow system performance if there is inadequate memory

Edit Rate Book

Rate Book Details

Policy Criteria
code + | gxcrtm_demo_rating Policy Line <applies toall>
Name o& | Generic RTM Demo Rating Jurisdiction % | <applies to all> +
Rate Tables | Rate Routines
Included Rate Tables ~) Available Rate Tables ge
Pending Import Name ‘Lookup
Li

Name
GenericStateTax

Memory

No data to display

Database

| Edit rate table lookup G

¢ The lookup setting can be changed only when the rate book is in Draft status
* The lookup setting is checked when a rate book is promoted from Draft to Stage

« When arate table is included in multiple rate books
* It can have only one lookup setting

* The setting can be changed only in the rate book that owns the rate table when it is in Draft

status PA RTM Demo Rating (Geemisoss)
Code pa_rtm_demo_rating -<applies to all>
a> > ee
= a me RSs es

| Rate table normalization Gi

Speeds up rate factor lookups, but requires more memory

Applies only when matching against more than one parameter, one of which is a
range parameter with overlapping ranges

Removes overlapping ranges by expanding the number of table rows in memory

Configuration parameters control whether or not PolicyCenter normalizes rate
table by default

Users can choose not to normalize a rate table by setting the Reduce Memory
Usage option

| Rate table normalization example

The rate table has two parameters: Age and Jurisdiction

+ Where age is a range parameter

Rate table in a rate book

Row#| Minimum Age | Maximum Age | Jurisdiction | * Factor
i 1 5 California 1
2 3 2
3 5 8 Oregon 3

Rate table normalized in memory for lookup

Row #| Minimum Age | Maximum Age | Jurisdiction | * Factor
1 1 3 California 1
2 3 5 California 1
3 3 5 2
4 5 6 2
5 5 6 Oregon 3
6 6 8 Oregon 3

| Parameters that control rate table normalization Gi

« RateTableManagementNormalizationRowThreshold

« If the number of rows in the normalized table exceeds this threshold, the user is given the
“Reduce Memory Usage” option to load a non-normalized version of the table

Rate Table Content

¢« RateTableManagementNormalizationRowLimit

« If the number of rows in the normalized table exceeds this limit, the table is automatically
marked as non-normalizable and PolicyCenter stores the non-normalized version of the table

| Demonstration G

Rating maintenance configuration

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question

,~ — When should you create a custom physical table?

¢
4
¢

seo eooce Sse Sbeese505

Answer Gi

,~ — When should you create a custom physical table?
¢
or In the base configuration there are two physical tables that can be used as-is and as
models for other custom tables that may be required for a particular implementation.
New custom physical table can be configured for one or a group of similar rate table

definitions if neither table is appropriate.

se sSeSo SoS Se See ese

Question

,~ — Arate table is normalized for what type of parameters in it?

¢
4
¢

seo eooce Sse Sbeese505

Answer

,~ — Arate table is normalized for what type of parameters in it?

¢
or Arate table is normalized for range parameters with overlapping ranges.

se sSeSo SoS Se See ese

objectives * Configure the rating plugin to allow rate books

review to be tested prior to release into a production
environment

¢ Describe ways to enhance rating performance
